column5: Good year for you , thanks for the recap ! Your picture with the buried truck is my kind of fishing , it looks to be in there pretty good . How did you get it out of that mess ?

I tried for 4 hours to get out with whatever nature had nearby and my dinky jack. When all that failed and I had no energy left, I called for Off-Road recovery and they got me out in 5 minutes haha  This poor truck has seen so much terrain and abuse, but it gets me to some nice quiet lakes!

Yep, the laker lake. You can tell by the tree line that it's the same lake, and in this pic you can just see the back of the little guy breaking the surface as well as my bottom-bouncer:    I think we only went to our walleye lake once with Joeytier all of this year, unless I'm not remembering right.  As for lakes around here, I dunno. A couple weeks ago I saw some crazy guys at a splake lake standing on the edge of the ice, near a current and open water... So I'm guessing by now it's probably fine for sane people.  I haven't gotten out yet, though.. I'm exhausted. But oh do I ever want a nice trout through the ice!

Figured I'd post this before Friday the 21st  Here is my year from winter to spring, summer, fall and back.  First sink full of winter walleye   NAW at the Nip G2G 2012   Nipfisher with a hot rod pike   Trouty   Tony and Alex's signature on Nipfisher's ice shack   Tony and Alex bringing in a nice Nip walleye!!!!   Wormdunker   Me with a Ling on Nip   Big Nip walleye (released)   Some kind of eel on a Ling   Bassassin with a big Ling   JoeyT with a pike     First launch in the early spring   Refurbished canoe   Manitoulin Rainbow   Some cured rainbow trout (Gravlax)   Spring lake brookie 15"   Wife with a small brookie   White bass from Nip   One amongst many smallies   Callander bay walleye   Feshwater sheaphead   Best pike of the year   Wife with a nice walleye     backlake walleye   another small lake walleye   large mouth...large smile   another back laker   Honeymoon!!   Honeymoon bass   Good job babe!!   nice dark fish   Dana looking for a walleye   JoeyT with a beautiful inland rainbow. wow!   Nice and stuck   First ice splake   and of course, first walleye of winter 2012!
Next year will include more brookies, and more hilarious shots of trucks getting stuck!!
great season chad thanks for the report If you get a chance next year. lets do some big water fishies
Love It !

lost the message , somewhere between my iPhone , Laptop and PC.... sorry. I typed out 200 words or more and they've gone missing in cyber space..  Anyway , message me back , I'll answer from my PC the only apparatus that seems to work for now.

Great year Chad. I,ll post mine,after the,aftermath.LOL  Dis sounded like a newfie talk. LOL  <iframe width="640" height="360" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/75iCxMIa1ew?feature=player_embedded" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>  Lord tundern bye.  Ya.I have talked to Blair.LOL  Same ting
Awesome report chad

You definitely have those walleyes dialed in Chad   Great year end review and report Thanks for sharing!  Oh, and you might want to think about a change in your handle... Rodcaster doesn't cut it in this report    WalleyeJunkie sounds more fitting Jacques
Awesome review. Looks like you had a good year..... was that one unknown fish a lamprey?
Good job buddy. Needed you out there with us today. I hope to be in alot more picture with you in 2013 (if we ever make it).
A good year for sure! Not everyone can line up pics like those ones.  Nice canoe, she is a beaut!  ...especially when atop a truck buried in mud. Lol  Looking forward to getting out again.

Well done! Looks like it was a terrific year for you. I'd like to hammer some of those ling this year if you feel up to it. The pic of the wife sitting in the canoe on the ice is classic! she doesn't look to impressed...
Great report, looks like a great year!
Great season Chad!  Nice report for sure.  I like Stash Tony's fish he drawing in Blair's hut.  That was a G@ for the memory books for sure.
Nice job Chad.  Love the wally pix!

You got that right. I have many brookie spots in mind.   You know it Rick! Someday I'll take you up on that offer.   Hahahaha. Does that mean I would have to listen to Skrillex too?   Once Nip locks up, we'll be hooking up more often for sure.   hahaha. ..that means I must have captured the moment! I had to remind her that canoes float.   Yes, that was a great meeting. I'm glad I took a  lot of photos.      Thanks for all comments!
Great year for sure.  The fact you went fishing on your honeymoon says a lot!!  Lucky dude!

1.  Stellar year for ya RC.  Great mixed bag but do love the walleye slaying going on.  And them ling!!!  2.  Didn't realize it, but this post clearly identified we at OFC have quite the North Bay group of anglers here.  Cool!
Andrew, between here and Sturgeon Falls we must have 20 OFC members. Nice that a few of us fish together regularly too.
Nice RC! great year.....love the variety of species.   TDunn
Great pics Chad. Good to be able to put some faces to the screenames of some of OFC's usual suspects!
Great recap, you've had quite a year!
You want my open water whities, I'd really like to stick a couple ling through the ice this year Hope your upcoming year's going to be as good, if not better!
That pic of me was not looking for a walleye, that was me losing that little pike - along with your Rapala!

Not the one while we were laker fishing, was it?  I thought this was from our top secret walleye lake... I might be wrong however.  The lakes must be locked up pretty good in your neck of the woods by now? Lets make plans
